channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Outside 44, 5th December
item.description:
The road has sunk and water is constantly pooling It has been reported several times over the years and it has not be actioned

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24, Ferncroft Avenue, West Hampstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: More signage by the pond stopping people feeding bread to ducks needed, 5th December
item.description:
There are only 2 small signs asking people to not feed ducks bread. I constantly see people feeding the ducks bread. It makes them unwell and can kill them. Please put more signs up and make them more visible to educate people and prevent harm to wildlife.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Springfield, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken pavement stones by heavy lorries driven and parked on the pavement, 5th December
item.description:
Clancy is doing utility works on Anerley Park Road. They drive and park heavy vehicles on the pavement which has substantially cracked a lot of the pavement stones. I guess they need to repair the damage on the pavement as a part of the contract. It would be worthwhile inspecting the damage caused by these works.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, Anerley Park, Crystal Palace, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Please remove litter collected by volunteer group, 5th December
item.description:
Please remove the litter we have collected today - 3 trollies, 6 gas canisters, 1 blue sack, box of bottles/ plastic, scraps of metal. Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crayford Way, Crayford, Dartford
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog fouling outside houses number 5 and 9., 5th December
item.description:
Dog fouling outside houses number 5 and 7.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bridge Road, Greater London

item.title: Graffiti on wall at junction of Lassell Street and Trafalgar Road, 5th December
item.description:
If you could paint over this and the graffiti on the junction box I’d be grateful. Thanks Chris

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Trafalgar Road, Greenwich

item.title: Abandoned vehicle and trailer loaded with rubbish, 5th December
item.description:
No numberplate on the trailer, vehicle looks very evidently abandoned and loaded up with junk. Been parked up for 3 days so far.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St Johns Road, Petts Wood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Leaves are making pavement unsafe for everyone including the large number of children going to school, 5th December
item.description:
The leaves are covering the pavement on the even side of the road on Holmdene Avenue. Many school children use this road and scooter bike on it. The leaves are making it unsafe. Has been like this for a number of weeks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Holmdene Avenue, Dulwich Village, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large amount of broken glass spread across pavement near entrance to River Grove Park, Rectory Road, Beckenham, 5th December
item.description:
Large amount of broken glass spread across pavement near entrance to River Grove Park, Rectory Road, Beckenham

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 77, Rectory Road, Beckenham, Greater London

item.title: Bus shelter leaning and damaged, 5th December
item.description:
Bus shelter was apparently hit by a vehicle. It has been taped off with red and white tape over a week ago as it is damaged, leaning and unsafe. It has been in poor condition for a long while before this incident. It needs to be replaced urgently.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 73, Tottenham Lane, Hornsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Paint on pavement, 5th December
item.description:
Pot of white paint thrown against shop window and spread across pavement. Shoreditch High street.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 128, Shoreditch High Street, Shoreditch, Greater London

item.title: NW6 6QD between no 16 and 36 Honiton Road, 5th December
item.description:
Leaves and litter need clearing on Honiton Road even number side between Hartland Road and Victoria Road. Thanks in advance. Please note plane trees on that part of Honiton Road were pollarded several weeks ago.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Honiton Road, London

item.title: General rubbish dumped, 5th December
item.description:
Near 23 Creasey Estate, could it be removed please? Thanks

item.title: Metal sticking up, 5th December
item.description:
There seems to be some metal sticking up out of the concrete on the crossing. In the dark this could be very dangerous and could catch someone on the leg.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Farnaby Road, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Commercial vehicle parked and blocking pavement, 5th December
item.description:
This vehicle has not moved for weeks and is not known locally, it is blocking the pavement causing pedestrians to walk on the road, including persons with children in prams and buggies

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hall Place Crescent, Crayford, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Southwark Council cause fly-tipping again, 5th December
item.description:
Southwark Council leave their blue rubbish bags next to the bins for days on end and the foxes rip them open disgusting rubbish all over our street for our children to walk through!!!!! Why has this been allowed???? Now the 'new' people feel it's ok to add to SC's waste and it gets worse and worse. Why do we have to endure this utter filth caused by Southwark Council DISGUSTING SHAMEFUL VILE UNSANITORY

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Oxenford Street, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Chewing Gum Everywhere, 5th December
item.description:
On the pavement, walking from Old Street station to Haberdasher Street there is so much gum all over the pavements. Can anything be done please?

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): East Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Van parked on grass verge, 5th December
item.description:
Van has been parked on the grass verge and not in designated parking bays for weeks. It looks like they’ve removed a wooden bollard to access the grass.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Downfield Road, Cheshunt
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin shed, 5th December
item.description:
Filled with cardboard, bins are next emptied properly, absolute mess!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Slade Green Road, Slade Green, Erith, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bright light on exterior of building shining directly into windows, 5th December
item.description:
There is a bright floodlight attached to the building that is on all night every night that shines directly into the properties on Adolphus Road. It is so bright that it is stopping occupants on Adolphus Road from sleeping.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Waverley Place, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
